wikipedia_page.main: Sir Montague Edward Smith (25 December 1806 – 3 May 1891) was a British barrister and judge who served as one of the last Justices of the Court of Common Pleas.

response: After a keen rivalry with Montague Edward Smith, afterwards a judge, for the foremost place, he obtained the lead of the circuit and kept it for many years.
Montague Edward Smith resigned after being appointed a Judge of the Court of Common Pleas, causing a by-election.
